intro: Ceropegia dalzielii, commonly known as the silver leaf ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, trailing stems and small, waxy leaves. The plant produces delicate, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often with a distinctive hooded shape. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia dalzielii is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
